page.title: 17CUSTOMS BELLRINGING TUNSTALL
page.content: Tunstall originally had five bells, cast between 1573 and 1702. These were recast into six by London bellfounder Thomas Mears in 1843.They were made up to eight in 1923 and restored in 1975. This cost 6,500pounds raised by local ringers and grants from the Kent County Assoc. of Change-Ringers.The bells were removed from the tower by local ringers and taken to Whitechapel Bellfoundry, London.The bells are now much easier to ring but owing to the poor quality of the original castings,the tune and tone of the bells could not be improved.The heaviest bell weighs only 7.5cwt.An enthusiastic local band practices every Friday for Sunday Service ringing and for weddings and special occasions.They also ring at Rodmersham and Bredgar,where there are no local bands.There have been three hour peals on the bells,first in 1900.
